comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: uche6215 on March 27, 2023, 02:32:43 PMNow I have lean to have more than one investment, it's never advised to have only one investment because in case one of the investment slide to the ground, so now I opened a fish farm.It's good if you have learned not to only have one investment source, but it's really nothing new; that's the step every person that wants to have a good financial airbag would take. I will also say that I am happy if it was through this forum that you were able to learn that aspect of building wealth.QuoteThe reason why I chose a fish farm business for my wife is that I don't see any stress in fish farming except for feeding and water changes. That's not really true. If you don't manage your fish farm so well, there can be a high rate of mortality (fingerlings dieing) in your farm. That's one challenge. Another challenge is that if you are not lucky to buy the first breeds of fingerlings to be hashed, you may end up buying the second stage which doesn't show a very fast growth like the first stage would.Thirdly, you need to always take note of their growth almost every month, to¬† separate the fast growing ones from the smallest ones, otherwise the big ones will eat up the small fish.Also, you need to protect the farm so that the predator doesn't intrude and eat up your fish, which can result in losses.You have to know the type of feed to give them and at what stage to change their feed; otherwise, you may not get the best growth for those fish.You need frequent supplies of water to keep up with the routine change of water since it's not an earthen pond.handling a fish farm requires enough attention and not just as easy as you assumed, I wish you success.
